tit.cmt: 用語登録では、「寒天」は「Japan agar」となっています。

sen.j: 寒天（かんてん）は、テングサ（天草）、オゴノリなどの紅藻類の粘液質を凍結・乾燥したものである。
sen.e: "Kanten" (agar or agar agar) is made from frozen and dried mucilage of red algae such as tengusa (agar weed) and ogonori (Chinese moss.)
sen.cmt: 用語登録では、「テングサ」は「gelidiaceae」と訳されています。
sen.e: "Kanten" (agar, or agar agar) is made from frozen and dried mucilage of red algae such as tengusa (agar weed) and ogonori (Chinese moss).
"Kanten" (agar, or agar agar) is made from frozen and dried mucilage of red algae such as tengusa (agar weed) and ogonori (Chinese moss).

sen.j: 一般に売られている寒天は、冬の寒冷地で自然凍結と天日乾燥を繰り返して作られている。
sen.e: Kanten sold at market is the one produced by freezing and drying itself repeatedly in a natural cold climate in winter.
Kanten, as sold at markets, is produced through repeated freezing and drying in a naturally cold climate during the winter.
Kanten, as sold at markets, is produced through repeated freezing and drying in a naturally cold climate during the winter.

sen.j: 食用のゲル（ゼリー）の材料という点では、ウシやブタから作られるゼラチンに似ているが、化学的には異なる物質である。
sen.e: It is similar to gelatine of bovine and swine as an ingredient of edible gel (jelly,) but is a chemically different substance.
It's similar to the gelatin of bovine and swine origin as an ingredient in edible gel (jelly), but chemically it's a different substance.
It's similar to the gelatin of bovine and swine origin as an ingredient in edible gel (jelly), but chemically it's a different substance.

sen.j: 江戸時代（徳川家綱の時代）1685年に現在の京都府伏見区において、旅館『美濃屋』の主人・美濃太郎左衛門が戸外に捨てたところてんが凍結し、日中は融け、日を経た乾物を発見した。
sen.e: In 1685 of the Edo Period (in the reign of Shogun Ietsuna TOKUGAWA,) Tarozaemon MINO, a lord of Japanese style inn "Minoya" located in current Fushimi Ward, Kyoto Prefecture, found tokoroten (gelidium jelly) which he had once thrown outside of his house became a dried foodstuff after having frozen and melted repeatedly for some nights and days.

In 1685, during the Edo period (in the reign of Shogun Ietsuna TOKUGAWA), Tarozaemon MINO, a lord of the Japanese-style inn "Minoya," located in what is now Fushimi Ward, Kyoto Prefecture, found that the tokoroten (gelidium jelly), which he had once thrown outside of his house, had become a dried foodstuff after having frozen and melted repeatedly for several nights and days.

In 1685, during the Edo period (in the reign of Shogun Ietsuna TOKUGAWA), Tarozaemon MINO, a lord of the Japanese-style inn "Minoya," located in what is now Fushimi Ward, Kyoto Prefecture, found that the tokoroten (gelidium jelly), which he had once thrown outside of his house, had become a dried foodstuff after having frozen and melted repeatedly for several nights and days.

sen.j: これでトコロテンをつくったところ、前よりも美しく海藻臭さが無いものができた。
sen.e: He tried to reuse this dried foodstuff and succeeded in making new tokoroten jelly with less odor of seaweed.
He tried to reuse this dried foodstuff and succeeded in making new tokoroten jelly with less of the seaweed odor.
He tried to reuse this dried foodstuff and succeeded in making new tokoroten jelly with less of the seaweed odor.

sen.j: 萬福寺を開創した隠元隆き禅師に試食してもらったところ、精進料理の食材として活用できると奨励された。
sen.e: He asked INGEN Ryuki Zenji (Ryuki INGEN, a master of Zen Buddhism,) the founder of Manpuku-ji temple, to taste the new tokoroten jelly, who then encouraged Tarozaemon to put it to practical use as an ingredient of vegetarian dish.

He asked INGEN Ryuki Zenji (Ryuki INGEN, a master of Zen Buddhism), the founder of Manpuku-ji Temple, to taste the new tokoroten jelly, and the latter then encouraged Tarozaemon to put it to practical use as an ingredient in vegetarian dishes.

He asked INGEN Ryuki Zenji (Ryuki INGEN, a master of Zen Buddhism), the founder of Manpuku-ji Temple, to taste the new tokoroten jelly, and the latter then encouraged Tarozaemon to put it to practical use as an ingredient in vegetarian dishes.

sen.j: 同時に名前を尋ねられたが、まだ決めていなかったためその旨伝えた。
sen.e: When the priest questioned Tarozaemon about its name, he replied that it had no name yet.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When the priest questioned Tarozaemon about its name, he replied that it had no name yet.
When the priest questioned Tarozaemon about its name, he replied that it had no name yet.

sen.j: そこで、隠元は「寒天」と命名したという。
sen.e: Then, reportedly, INGEN gave it a name of "Kanten."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Reportedly, INGEN then gave it the name "Kanten."
Reportedly, Ingen then gave it the name 'Kanten.'

sen.j: その後、大阪の宮田半兵衛が製法を改良し寒天を広げる。
sen.e: Subsequently, Hanbei MIYATA in Osaka made an improvement in its manufacturing process and diffused it.
Subsequently, Hanbei MIYATA, in Osaka, made an improvement in the manufacturing process and diffused it.
Subsequently, Hanbei MIYATA, in Osaka, made an improvement in the manufacturing process and diffused it.

sen.j: さらに、天保年間に信濃国の行商人・小林粂左衛門が諏訪地域の農家の副業として寒天作りを広め、角寒天として定着した。
sen.e: Further in the Tenpo era, Kumezaemon KOBAYASHI, a peddler from Shinano Province, promoted manufacturing of kanten as a second job of farmers in Suwa area, and settled it as kaku-kanten (agar in the shape of rectangular bar.)

Further, during the Tenpo era Kumezaemon KOBAYASHI, a peddler from Shinano Province, promoted the manufacture of kanten as a second job among farmers in the Suwa area, and established it as kaku-kanten (agar in the shape of a rectangular bar).

Further, during the Tenpo era Kumezaemon KOBAYASHI, a peddler from Shinano Province, promoted the manufacture of kanten as a second job among farmers in the Suwa area, and established it as kaku-kanten (agar in the shape of a rectangular bar).

sen.j: 1881年、ロベルト・コッホが寒天培地による真正細菌培養法を開発技術開発したため、寒天の国際的需要が増えた。
sen.e: In 1881, Robert Koch developed technologies of culturing eubacterium using agar medium, since when demand for kanten has increased in the world.
In 1881, Robert Koch developed the technology of culturing eubacterium using agar medium, and since then the demand for kanten has increased throughout the world.
In 1881, Robert Koch developed the technology of culturing eubacterium using agar medium, and since then the demand for kanten has increased throughout the world.

sen.j: このため、第二次世界大戦前は寒天が日本の重要な貿易品であったが、第二次世界大戦中は戦略的意味合いから輸出を禁止した。
sen.e: This made kanten one of the major exporting items before the World War II, but, during the war period, it was banned to export kanten from Japan due to strategical reasons.
This made kanten one of the major export items before World War II, but, during the war period the exportation of kanten from Japan was banned for strategic reasons.
This made kanten one of the major export items before World War II, but, during the war period the exportation of kanten from Japan was banned for strategic reasons.

sen.j: 寒天の供給を絶たれた諸外国は自力による寒天製造を試み、自然に頼らない工業的な寒天製造法を開発した。
sen.e: The countries, whose routes to import kanten from Japan were cut out, were forced to try production of kanten by themselves and could eventually develop industrial method to manufacture kanten without relying on natural conditions.

The countries that would otherwise have imported kanten from Japan could no longer do so; consequently, they were forced to try producing kanten and eventually developed industrial methods of producing kanten without relying on natural conditions.

The countries that would otherwise have imported kanten from Japan could no longer do so; consequently, they were forced to try producing kanten and eventually developed industrial methods of producing kanten without relying on natural conditions.

sen.j: こうして作られたのが粉末寒天である。
sen.e: Thus, powdered kanten became available.
Thus, powdered kanten became available.
Thus, powdered kanten became available.

sen.j: 1946年になると日本でも研究が始まり、1970年頃には製造会社が35社にまで達した。
sen.e: Also in Japan, research for making powdered kanten had started in 1946, and the number of its producers reached 35 companies in 1970.
Also in Japan, research in the production of powdered kanten started in 1946, and by 1970 the number of its producing companies had reached 35.
Also in Japan, research in the production of powdered kanten started in 1946, and by 1970 the number of its producing companies had reached 35.

sen.j: しかし、2004年現在は5社ほどにまで激減。
sen.e: But, since then, it has been drastically reduced to five companies in 2004.
However, as of 2004 there were only five such companies involved.
However, as of 2004 there were only five such companies involved.

sen.j: 現在一般的に売られているものは、硫酸や塩酸などで澱粉を溶解し、色や独特の風味を取り除いて漂白されたものがほとんどである。
sen.e: Today, most of kanten sold at market are bleached products after removing any color and typical flavor of seaweeds by dissolving starch substance with sulphuric acid, hydrochloric acid and so on.
sen.cmt: 「独特の風味」を「海藻の独特の風味」と解して訳しました。
sen.e: Today, most of the kanten sold in markets is a product that's bleached following the removal of any color and typical flavor of seaweed; this is done by dissolving the starchy substance with sulphuric acid, hydrochloric acid and so on.

Today, most of the kanten sold in markets is a product that's bleached following the removal of any color and typical flavor of seaweed; this is done by dissolving the starchy substance with sulphuric acid, hydrochloric acid and so on.

sen.j: 諸外国ではモロッコ、ポルトガル、スペイン、チリやアルゼンチンで良質の寒天が製造されている。
sen.e: Outside Japan, kanten of good quality are produced in Morocco, Portugal, Spain, Chile and Argentine.
Outside Japan, good-quality kanten is produced in Morocco, Portugal, Spain, Chile and Argentina.
Outside Japan, good-quality kanten is produced in Morocco, Portugal, Spain, Chile and Argentina.

sen.j: 12月から翌年2月の厳寒期に寒天は製造される。
sen.e: Kanten is produced in a season of severe cold, from December to February in the following year.
Kanten is produced in a season of severe cold, from December to February of the following year.
Kanten is produced in a season of severe cold, from December to February of the following year.

sen.j: 原料海藻の精製
sen.e: Refining of raw seaweeds:
Refining the raw seaweed
Refining the raw seaweed

sen.j: テングサは、砂浜にひろげ、ときおり淡水を注いで十数日間陽光を浴びせた薄黄色のさらしテングサを用いる。
sen.e: Spread out tengusa weeds over a sand beach, spray fresh water on them from time to time, and expose them to the sun light for ten-odd days, until they become bleached into pale yellow.
Spread out tengusa seaweed over a sandy beach, spray fresh water onto it from time to time, and expose it to sunlight for ten or so days, until it becomes a pale yellow.
Spread out tengusa seaweed over a sandy beach, spray fresh water onto it from time to time, and expose it to sunlight for ten or so days, until it becomes a pale yellow.

sen.j: これを河川の水に浸し、柔らかくしたものを水車でつく。
sen.e: Soak the bleached weeds in water of a river to make them soft, and then pound them by a water mill.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Soak the bleached seaweed in river water to soften it, and then pound it in a water mill.
Soak the bleached seaweed in river water to soften it, and then pound it in a water mill.

sen.j: そして、貝殻、砂その他を取り除き、流水にさらし、塩分、色素を除く。
sen.e: After removing sands and other foreign materials from the pounded weeds, expose them to running water for desalination and depigmentation.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After removing the sand and other foreign materials from the pounded seaweed, expose it to running water for desalination and depigmentation.
After removing the shell, the sand and other foreign materials from the pounded seaweed, expose it to running water for desalination and depigmentation.

sen.j: 配合
sen.e: Composition:
Composition
Composition

sen.j: 20%ないし40%の他の海藻を配合する。
sen.e: Add other seaweeds at a rate of twenty to forty percent.
Add seaweed at a rate of 20% to 40%.
Add seaweed at a rate of 20% to 40%.

sen.j: これはテングサが高価であり、またテングサのみでは固すぎるためである。
sen.e: This is because tengusa weeds are expensive and also because pure tengusa weeds consolidate too hard.
This is because tengusa seaweed is expensive and because pure tengusa consolidates too hard.
This is because tengusa seaweed is expensive and because pure tengusa consolidates too hard.

sen.j: 煮熟
sen.e: Boiling and ageing:
Boiling and aging
Boiling and aging

sen.j: 沸湯に原料海藻を投入し、粘質分を溶出させるために硫酸または酢酸少量を加え、約3時間煮沸する。
sen.e: Boil the raw seaweeds for about three hours in boiling water containing a little bit of sulfuric acid and acetic acid to elute mucilage of the weeds.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Boil the raw seaweed for about three hours in water containing a small amount of sulfuric acid and acetic acid to elute the mucilage of the seaweed.
Boil the raw seaweed for about three hours in water containing a small amount of sulfuric acid and acetic acid to elute the mucilage of the seaweed.

sen.j: そして、火を弱め摂氏70度 - 80度に保つ。
sen.e: Then, reduce the heat of boiling water to 70 to 80 degrees centigrade and keep the weeds in that temperature.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Reduce the heat of the boiling water to 70 to 80 degrees centigrade and maintain that temperature.
Reduce the heat of the boiling water to 70 to 80 degrees centigrade and maintain that temperature.

sen.j: 通常は原料海藻12kg当たり水約4kl、硫酸30g（水で希釈）を用いる。
sen.e: About 4kl of water and 30g of sulfuric acid (diluted with water) are usually used for 12kg of raw seaweeds.
A solution of approximately 4kl of water and 30g of sulfuric acid (diluted with water) is usually used for 12kg of raw seaweed.
A solution of approximately 4 kl of water and 30 g of sulfuric acid (diluted with water) is usually used for 12 kg of raw seaweed.

sen.j: 濾過
sen.e: Filtration:
Filtration
Filtration

sen.j: 麻袋にいれ、緩く圧して濾液を取り、静置しうわずみを取る。
sen.e: Put the boiled weeds into a jute bag and squeeze it gently to take out filtered liquid which is then left at rest to obtain supernatant fluid from it.
Place the boiled seaweed in a jute bag and squeeze it gently to filter out the liquid, which is then left at rest to obtain the supernatant fluid from it.
Place the boiled seaweed in a jute bag and squeeze it gently to filter out the liquid, which is then left at rest to obtain the supernatant fluid from it.

sen.j: 絞り滓は2番煮をおこない、1番煮汁に混ぜ、あるいは新原料海藻の1番煮に用いる。
sen.e: Boil again the marc of the squeezed weeds to obtain secondary liquid, and mix the liquid with freshly boiled liquid or use it to boil new raw weeds.
Again, boil the marc of the squeezed seaweed to obtain the secondary liquid, and mix the liquid with freshly boiled liquid or use it to boil new, raw seaweed.
Again, boil the marc of the squeezed seaweed to obtain the secondary liquid, and mix the liquid with freshly boiled liquid or use it to boil new, raw seaweed.

sen.j: 凝固
sen.e: Coagulation:
Coagulation
Coagulation

sen.j: うわずみを容器に移し、放冷し、トコロテンに凝固させる。
sen.e: Transfer the supernatant fluid into a container for standing to cool and coagulation to make tokoroten (gelidium jelly.)
Transfer the supernatant fluid into a container, and let it stand to cool and coagulate, thus making tokoroten (gelidium jelly).
Transfer the supernatant fluid into a container, and let it stand to cool and coagulate, thus making tokoroten (gelidium jelly).

sen.j: 角寒天の場合、約4cm角柱に切る。
sen.e: For kaku-kanten (agar in the shape of rectangular bar,) cut the congealed tokoroten jelly into the shape of rectangular columns of four centimeter side of cut square section.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For kaku-kanten (agar in the shape of a rectangular bar), cut the congealed tokoroten jelly into the shape of rectangular columns with sides four centimeters wide.
For kaku-kanten (agar in the shape of a rectangular bar), cut the congealed tokoroten jelly into the shape of rectangular columns with sides four centimeters wide.

sen.j: 細寒天の場合、トコロテン突きで5mm角の線状に突き出す。
sen.e: For hoso-kanten (string-type agar,) use an extruder to push out strings of tokoroten of five millimeter side of cut square section.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For hoso-kanten (string-type agar), use an extruder to push out strings of tokoroten with square-cut sections five millimeters wide.
For hoso-kanten (string-type agar), use an extruder to push out strings of tokoroten with square-cut sections five millimeters wide.

sen.j: そして、それらを蓆の上に並べる。
sen.e: And, lay each of the cut or extruded tokoroten side by side on mushiro (straw mats.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Lay the cut or extruded pieces of tokoroten side by side on mushiro (straw mats).
Lay the cut or extruded pieces of tokoroten side by side on mushiro (straw mats).

sen.j: 凍結
sen.e: Freezing:
Freezing
Freezing

sen.j: 凍結場は、周囲に高さ1間ほどの防風垣を立てめぐらせ、東西に杭（高さ50cmくらい）を打ち、横木を渡し、その上にトコロテンを並べた蓆を置き、寒い夜に凍結させる。
sen.e: Freezing field is surrounded by shelter hedges of about 1.8m high, where stakes of about 50cm long are piled on east and west ends to support crossbars on which straw mats with tokoroten jelly are laid to freeze during cold nights.

The freezing field is surrounded by shelter hedges about 1.8m high, where stakes about 50cm long are piled on the east and west ends to support crossbars on which straw mats with tokoroten jelly are laid to freeze in the cold night air.

The freezing field is surrounded by shelter hedges about 1.8 m high, where stakes about 50 cm long are piled on the east and west ends to support crossbars on which straw mats with tokoroten jelly are laid to freeze in the cold night air.

sen.j: 角寒天は、2晩かけての凍結完了が最上とされる。
sen.e: Kaku-kanten made after logging two nights for complete freezing is regarded as of the best quality.
Kaku-kanten, which is made after logging two nights of complete freezing, is regarded as being the best in quality.
Kaku-kanten, which is made after logging two nights of complete freezing, is regarded as being the best in quality.

sen.j: 酷寒のために1晩で急激な凍結が起こると、寒天質と氷とは別に分かれてしまい形質不良となる。
sen.e: If it is severely cold enough to freeze kanten so quickly as in one night only, agar polymers will become separated from water ice making its quality and shape poor.
If it's cold enough to freeze the kanten so quickly in just one night, the agar polymers will become separated from the ice, resulting in poor shape and quality.
If it's cold enough to freeze the kanten so quickly in just one night, the agar polymers will become separated from the ice, resulting in poor shape and quality.

sen.j: 温暖のために凍結に 4 - 5 晩かかると腐敗にかたむき、発色してしまう。
sen.e: If it is so warm as to require four or five nights to freeze kanten, the products tend to decay and will be colored.
If it is mild enough to require four or five nights to freeze the kanten, the resulting product will tend to decay and be colored.
If it is mild enough to require four or five nights to freeze the kanten, the resulting product will tend to decay and be colored.

sen.j: 細寒天はこのような苦労が少ない。
sen.e: Compared with kaku-kanten, hoso-kanten requires less pain in its freezing process.
Compared with kaku-kanten, hoso-kanten requires less pain in the freezing process.
Compared with kaku-kanten, hoso-kanten requires less pain in the freezing process.

sen.j: 融解
sen.e: Melting:
Melting
Melting

sen.j: 凍結したら翌朝、陽光に当て、氷を融かし水分を滴下させる。
sen.e: Frozen kanten is to be exposed to sunlight on the next morning in order to melt the ice portion into water and let the water dribble out.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Frozen kanten is to be exposed to sunlight on the next morning in order to melt the ice portion into water and let the water dribble out.
Frozen kanten is to be exposed to sunlight on the next morning in order to melt the ice portion into water and let the water dribble out.

sen.j: さらに数日間日乾しして完成品とする。
sen.e: Then, it will be dried out under sunlight for additional several days to make final products.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It will then dry in the sun for several more days, resulting in the final product.
It will then dry in the sun for several more days, resulting in the final product.

sen.j: ほとんどは食物繊維（アガロースやアガロペクチンなどの多糖類）からできており、ヒトの消化酵素のみでは分解されない。
sen.e: Most of kanten consists of dietary fibres (a mixture of polysaccharides such as agarose and agaropectin,) which cannot be dissolved by human digestive enzime.
Most kanten consists of dietary fiber (a mixture of polysaccharides such as agarose and agaropectin), which can't be dissolved by human digestive enzymes.
Most kanten consists of dietary fiber (a mixture of polysaccharides such as agarose and agaropectin), which can't be dissolved by human digestive enzymes.

sen.j: ただし、いくらかは、胃酸により分解しアガロオリゴ糖となり吸収され、生理的な作用をもつことが近年研究されている。
sen.e: According to a recent research, however, it is reported that some constituents of kanten may be dissolved by gastric acid into agaro-oligosaccharide which is absorbed into human body with some physiological actions.

According to recent research, however, some constituents of kanten may be dissolved by gastric acid into agaro-oligosaccharide, which is absorbed into the human body to produce certain physiological actions.

According to recent research, however, some constituents of kanten may be dissolved by gastric acid into agaro-oligosaccharide, which is absorbed into the human body to produce certain physiological actions.

sen.j: 寒天の凝固作用は多糖類に由来する。
sen.e: Coaguration of kanten is caused by polysaccharide.
The coagulation of kanten is caused by polysaccharide.
The coagulation of kanten is caused by polysaccharide.

sen.j: このため、パイナップルやキウイフルーツなどの果物に含まれるプロテアーゼ（タンパク質分解酵素）によって凝固が阻害されることがない。
sen.e: Accordingly, the process of its coaguration cannot be blocked by protease (proteolytic enzyme) contained in such fruits as pineapples and kiwi fruits.
Accordingly, the process of coagulation can't be blocked by the protease (proteolytic enzyme) contained in such fruits as pineapple and kiwi.
Accordingly, the process of coagulation can't be blocked by the protease (proteolytic enzyme) contained in such fruits as pineapple and kiwi.

sen.j: 粉末寒天
sen.e: Funmatsu kanten (powdered agar)
Funmatsu kanten (powdered agar)
Funmatsu kanten (powdered agar)

sen.j: 高純度で品質は均一。
sen.e: Its highly pure and consistent quality is maintained.
Its high purity and consistent quality are maintained.
Its high purity and consistent quality are maintained.

sen.j: 溶解性に優れる。
sen.e: It is superior in solubility.
It has superior solubility.
It has superior solubility.

sen.j: フレーク寒天
sen.e: Flake kanten (flake agar):
Flake kanten (flake agar):
Flake kanten (flake agar):

sen.j: 沈殿しにくいので焦げ付きにくい。
sen.e: Its little precipitability makes it hard to burn dry.
Its minimal precipitability makes it hard to burn dry.
Its minimal precipitability makes it hard to burn dry.

sen.j: 高級和菓子用。
sen.e: It is applied to high class Japanese confectionery.
It's applied to high-class Japanese confectionery.
It's applied to high-class Japanese confectionery.

sen.j: 固形寒天
sen.e: Kokei-kanten (solid agar):
Kokei-kanten (solid agar):
Kokei-kanten (solid agar):

sen.j: 定量で作られているので計量の必要がない。
sen.e: Because of its batch production system, no weighing process is required.
Because of the batch production system, no weighing process is required.
Because of the batch production system, no weighing process is required.

sen.j: 品質は均一。
sen.e: It is consistent in quality, too.
It is consistent in quality, too.
It is consistent in quality, too.

sen.j: 角寒天
sen.e: Kaku-kanten (agar in the shape of rectangular bar)
Kaku-kanten (agar in the shape of a rectangular bar)
Kaku-kanten (agar in the shape of a rectangular bar)

sen.j: 水漬けと裏漉しが必要。
sen.e: It must be rinsed in water and pureed.
It must be rinsed in water and then pureed.
It must be rinsed in water and then pureed.

sen.j: 品質は不均一。
sen.e: It is not consistent in quality.
It is not consistent in quality.
It is not consistent in quality.

sen.j: 家庭料理用。
sen.e: It is used for home cuisines.
It's used in homemade cuisine.
It's used in homemade cuisine.

sen.j: 糸寒天
sen.e: Ito-kanten (string-type agar):
Ito-kanten (string-type agar):
Ito-kanten (string-type agar):

sen.j: 性質はほとんど角寒天と同じ。
sen.e: Its quality is almost same as kaku-kanten.
Its quality is nearly equal to kaku-kanten.
Its quality is nearly equal to kaku-kanten.

sen.j: 和菓子用。
sen.e: It is used for various Japanese-style confectionery.
It's used for various kinds of Japanese confections.
It's used for various kinds of Japanese confections.

sen.j: 菓子の材料に用いられる他、ほとんどカロリーがないこと、腸において油や糖分の吸収をさまたげることから、ダイエット食品としても注目されている。
sen.e: Beside its usage as ingredients of cakes, it attracts attention as a diet food because it has almost no calorie and deters intestinum from absorbing oil and sugar contents.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition to being used as an ingredient in cakes, it has attracted attention as a diet food because it has very few calories and deters the intestinum from absorbing oil and sugar.
In addition to being used as an ingredient in cakes, it has attracted attention as a diet food because it has very few calories and deters the intestinum from absorbing oil and sugar.

sen.j: また、前述のアガロオリゴ糖に着目した健康食品としても注目されている。
sen.e: It also draws attention as a healthy food because of the above mentioned agaro-oligosaccharide.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It has also drawn attention as a healthy food because of the above-mentioned agaro-oligosaccharide.
It has also drawn attention as a healthy food because of the above-mentioned agaro-oligosaccharide.

sen.j: 立方体状に裁断してあんみつの中に入れる。
sen.e: Kanten is cut into cubes to be put into anmitsu (a bowl of sweets containg boiled beans, cubes of agar gelatine and bits of fruits with a sweet syrup poured over them.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kanten is cut into cubes for use in anmitsu (a bowl of sweets containg boiled beans, cubes of agar gelatine and bits of fruit with a sweet syrup poured over them).
Kanten is cut into cubes for use in anmitsu (a bowl of sweets containing boiled beans, cubes of agar gelatin and bits of fruit with a sweet syrup poured over them).

sen.j: そのほか、牛乳に粉末寒天を添加し、固形にした加工食品（食品）は牛乳寒あるいは牛乳羹と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Besides, a solid processed food, called gyunyu-kan (a sweet milk gelly) is made by adding funmatsu-kanten (powdered agar) into milk and solidifying it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Moreover, a solid processed food, called gyunyu-kan (a sweet milk jelly) is made by adding funmatsu-kanten (powdered agar) into milk and allowing it to solidify.
Moreover, a solid processed food, called gyunyu-kan (a sweet milk jelly) is made by adding funmatsu-kanten (powdered agar) into milk and allowing it to solidify.

sen.j: これは中華料理の杏仁豆腐に好んで利用される。
sen.e: This is preferably used for annindofu (an almond jelly) of Chinese cuisine.
This is preferably used for annindofu (an almond jelly) of Chinese cuisine.
This is preferably used for annindofu (an almond jelly) of Chinese cuisine.

sen.j: 植物の組織培養や微生物培養の際、培地の固形化に用いられている。
sen.e: Kanten is used to make solid media for culturing plant tissues and microorganisms.
Kanten is used to make solid media for culturing plant tissues and microorganisms.
Kanten is used to make solid media for culturing plant tissues and microorganisms.

sen.j: 寒天で固めた培地は寒天培地と呼ばれ、ほとんど培地の代名詞のような存在である。
sen.e: Any medium solidified by kanten is called "agar medium" which term has become as much as a synonym for all culture media.
Any medium solidified by kanten is called "agar medium," and this term has become a synonym for all culture media.
Any medium solidified by kanten is called "agar medium," and this term has become a synonym for all culture media.

sen.j: また特に純度の高いものは核酸の電気泳動（アガロースゲル電気泳動）にも使用される。
sen.e: Especially, high purity kanten is used for cataphoresis of nucleic acid (cataphoresis of agarose gel.)
Especially, high-purity kanten is used for the cataphoresis of nucleic acid (cataphoresis of agarose gel).
Especially, high-purity kanten is used for the cataphoresis of nucleic acid (cataphoresis of agarose gel).

sen.j: 歯科医療
sen.e: Dental treatment:
Dental treatment
Dental treatment

sen.j: う蝕により失われた歯形態は、ごく一部の例外を除き再生することはない。
sen.e: A form of tooth damaged by dental caries shall never recover except very rare cases.
A tooth that has been damaged by dental caries will not recover its form, except in very rare cases.
A tooth that has been damaged by dental caries will not recover its form, except in very rare cases.

sen.j: 歯冠を修復する場合、歯科医師がI（補綴物）を作りやすい形に切削する。
sen.e: In order to mend a crown of tooth (corona dentis,) the tooth is cut into the shape which allows a dentist to easily fabricate a top cover (prosthetic appliance) to fit.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In order to mend the crown of a tooth (corona dentis), the tooth is cut into a shape that allows a dentist to easily fabricate a cover (prosthetic appliance) to fit it.
In order to mend the crown of a tooth (corona dentis), the tooth is cut into a shape that allows a dentist to easily fabricate a cover (prosthetic appliance) to fit it.

sen.j: 後日、でき上がった補綴物を患者に装着し治療を終える。
sen.e: Then, the fabricated prosthetic appliance is fixed to the patient's tooth, to complete the treatment.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The fabricated prosthetic is then attached to the patient's tooth, completing the process.
The fabricated prosthetic is then attached to the patient's tooth, completing the process.

sen.j: 補綴物は主に金属製で融点の都合上、患者の口内で製作できないため、歯並びを精密に再現した石膏模型が必要になる。
sen.e: Since this prosthetic appliance which is mostly made of metal cannot be fabricated inside the patient's mouth due to its melting point, it becomes necessary to prepare a plaster figure which duplicates exactly the patient's teeth alignment.

Since this prosthetic, which is mostly made of metal, can't be fabricated inside the patient's mouth due to its melting point, it becomes necessary to prepare a plaster figure that precisely duplicates the patient's tooth alignment.

Since this prosthetic, which is mostly made of metal, can't be fabricated inside the patient's mouth due to its melting point, it becomes necessary to prepare a plaster figure that precisely duplicates the patient's tooth alignment.

sen.j: 石膏模型は、弾力性があり細部が再現できるなどの要件を満たす材料（印象材）で歯並びを再現した物に歯科用の石膏を流し込んでつくる。
sen.e: The plaster figure is fashioned by pouring dental plasters into a duplicate made of such materials (impression materials) as to satisfy the requirement for elasticity enough to recreate details of patient's teeth alignment.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The plaster figure is fashioned by pouring dental plaster into a duplicate made of such materials (impression materials) and thereby provide elasticity sufficient to recreate the details of the patient's tooth alignment.

The plaster figure is fashioned by pouring dental plaster into a duplicate made of such materials (impression materials) and thereby provide elasticity sufficient to recreate the details of the patient's tooth alignment.

sen.j: そして、石膏の硬化を待ち、形を整えて出来上がる。
sen.e: After the plaster is consolidated, the shape of the plaster figure is finally adjusted.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Once the plaster has solidified, the final adjustments are made to the shape of the plaster figure.
Once the plaster has solidified, the final adjustments are made to the shape of the plaster figure.

sen.j: 歯科医療に用いる印象材の一つに寒天印象材がある。
sen.e: One of impression materials used for dental treatment is the one made of agar.
One of the impression materials used for dental treatment is made of agar.
One of the impression materials used for dental treatment is made of agar.

sen.j: 寒天印象材は弾力性があり細部再現性は良好であるが、寸法安定性が悪く水分を吸収すれば膨張し大気中に長時間放置すれば寒天内の水分が蒸発し収縮してしまう。
sen.e: The agar material is excellent at elasticity to reproduce details, but is inferior in dimentional stability so that it swells by absorbing moisture and contracts by evaporating water when exposed to the air for a long time.

The agar material offers the excellent elasticity needed to reproduce details, but it's inferior in dimensional stability so that it swells by absorbing moisture and contracts due to evaporation when exposed to the air for a prolonged period of time.

The agar material offers the excellent elasticity needed to reproduce details, but it's inferior in dimensional stability so that it swells by absorbing moisture and contracts due to evaporation when exposed to the air for a prolonged period of time.

sen.j: よって、寒天印象材からは素早く石膏模型を製作しなければならない。
sen.e: Therefore, plaster figures must be quicly produced out of agar impression materials.
Thus the plaster figure must be quickly produced from the agar impression material.
Thus the plaster figure must be quickly produced from the agar impression material.
